name: Chipotle Cream Cheese Taquitos
description: Adding cream cheese to your taquitos is a massively rewarding shortcut to take!  We're also using some Tomatillo Chipotle Salsa in this batch -- so good!

recipeInstructions.text: If you're poaching the chicken, add 2 chicken breasts to a saucepan and cover with cold tap water.  Bring to a boil and then reduce heat to let simmer for 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. You can optionally add some flavoring to the water -- for this batch I added salt, pepper, onion and cilantro. Once cooked, set the chicken breasts aside to cool and then use two forks to shred them.
recipeInstructions.name: If you're poaching the chicken, add 2 chicken breasts to a saucepan and cover with cold tap water.  Bring to a boil and then reduce heat to let simmer for 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. You can optionally add some flavoring to the water -- for this batch I added salt, pepper, onion and cilantro. Once cooked, set the chicken breasts aside to cool and then use two forks to shred them.

recipeInstructions.text: To make the Tomatillo Chipotle Salsa, start by removing the husks and stems from the tomatillos.   Give them a good rinse and roast them in a 400F oven until they start to turn army green in color, approx. 10-15 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: To make the Tomatillo Chipotle Salsa, start by removing the husks and stems from the tomatillos.   Give them a good rinse and roast them in a 400F oven until they start to turn army green in color, approx. 10-15 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the roasted tomatillos to a blender along 3-4 chipotles in adobo and 2 garlic cloves.  I typically remove the seeds from the chipotles.  Combine well and taste for heat level.  Add 4 oz. cream cheese to the blender and combine well.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the roasted tomatillos to a blender along 3-4 chipotles in adobo and 2 garlic cloves.  I typically remove the seeds from the chipotles.  Combine well and taste for heat level.  Add 4 oz. cream cheese to the blender and combine well.

recipeInstructions.text: In a mixing bowl, combine the shredded chicken with the Salsa mixture from the blender and add 1/2 onion finely chopped,1 teaspoon salt, and some freshly cracked black pepper.  Mix well and take a final taste for seasoning and heat level.  (I added some more adobo sauce and another pinch of salt to this batch.)
recipeInstructions.name: In a mixing bowl, combine the shredded chicken with the Salsa mixture from the blender and add 1/2 onion finely chopped,1 teaspoon salt, and some freshly cracked black pepper.  Mix well and take a final taste for seasoning and heat level.  (I added some more adobo sauce and another pinch of salt to this batch.)

recipeInstructions.text: Add the tortillas to a plate and cover with damp paper towels.  Microwave for 60 seconds or until the tortillas are soft and pliable.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the tortillas to a plate and cover with damp paper towels.  Microwave for 60 seconds or until the tortillas are soft and pliable.

recipeInstructions.text: Add 2-3 tablespoons of chicken mixture to each tortilla.   Roll tight and place them seam side down on a baking sheet.  Add a thin layer of oil to each taquito before baking them (I used an olive oil sprayer).
recipeInstructions.name: Add 2-3 tablespoons of chicken mixture to each tortilla.   Roll tight and place them seam side down on a baking sheet.  Add a thin layer of oil to each taquito before baking them (I used an olive oil sprayer).

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 20 minutes in a 400F oven or until the edges are turning darker brown.  Serve immediately.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 20 minutes in a 400F oven or until the edges are turning darker brown.  Serve immediately.

recipeInstructions.text: If you want to make the Guacamole, finely chop 2-3 tablespoons of onion.  Use the back of a fork to smoosh the onion until it turns translucent.   Add the onion to a bowl along with the flesh of one avocado, 1/4 teaspoon of salt, and the juice of a half lime.  Mush and mix well.  Taste for salt level.  Keep adding tiny dashes of salt (and lime) until you like it.
recipeInstructions.name: If you want to make the Guacamole, finely chop 2-3 tablespoons of onion.  Use the back of a fork to smoosh the onion until it turns translucent.   Add the onion to a bowl along with the flesh of one avocado, 1/4 teaspoon of salt, and the juice of a half lime.  Mush and mix well.  Taste for salt level.  Keep adding tiny dashes of salt (and lime) until you like it.
